snippet: Some consumers are finding that their electronic devices cause allergic reactions, a problem that is increasing as the devices become wearable.
abstract: Some doctors and consumers have expressed concerns about lack of regulatory oversight to monitor frequency of skin allergies and other reactions to certain metals or plastics used in products; United States has no restrictions on widespread use of nickel, one of the most common allergens in the country, which could lead to spike in allergic reactions.
lead_paragraph: Some consumers are finding that their electronic devices cause allergic reactions, a problem that is increasing as the devices become wearable.

headline.main: Nickel Allergies on Rise as Devices Meet Skin
headline.print_headline: Nickel Allergies on Rise as Devices Meet Skin
